title: Definitions
context: PART II. COLD STORAGE OF FOOD §328-41 Definitions. &ldquo;Cold storage&rdquo; as used in sections 328-41 to 328-48 means a place artificially cooled to a temperature of forty degrees Fahrenheit or below but does not include such a place in a private home, hotel, restaurant, or exclusively retail establishment not storing articles of food for other persons. &ldquo;Cold stored&rdquo; as used in such sections means the keeping of articles of food in cold storage for a period exceeding thirty days from the date of placing them in any cold storage or refrigerating warehouse. &ldquo;Storer&rdquo; means the person who offers articles of food for cold storage. &ldquo;Operator&rdquo; means any person operating a cold storage. [L 1925, c 194, §1; RL 1935, §1063; RL 1945, §2232; RL 1955, §51-40; HRS §328-41]
